question: What is CoinTutor?
answer: CoinTutor is a subscription-based tutoring platform that provides cryptocurrency investment information. Regular users subscribe to tutors and use learning content (studies, exams, practice questions) and coin recommendations. Tutors register as investment experts to create learning content, provide coin recommendations, and earn subscription revenue. All payments, deposits, withdrawals, subscription fees, and earnings are processed in USDT (Tether) only.

question: What does CoinTutor offer?
answer: The service consists of Learning, Recommendations, Subscriptions, Wallet, and Referral. Learning includes studies, exams, voice interviews, and practice (tutor-specific content). Recommendations are tutors' coin picks (target price, target date, analysis) and are viewable by members and above. Subscriptions are monthly USDT payments per tutor to access that tutor's learning and recommendations. Wallet handles USDT deposit, withdrawal, and balance. Referral pays commission in USDT when someone subscribes via your link.

question: What are the CoinTutor membership levels?
answer: Regular member: sign-up only — can use learning, cannot view coin recommendations. Associate: after clicking Become Member, before USDT payment — can use learning, cannot view recommendations. Member: after USDT payment — can use both learning and coin recommendations. Coin recommendations are available only to members (subscription paid).

question: What currency does CoinTutor use?
answer: All amounts are displayed and processed in USDT (Tether) only. Examples: 29.99 USDT, 1000 USDT. Other currencies (USD, KRW, etc.) are not used. The platform uses a single stablecoin (USDT) for payment policy and regulatory consistency.

question: How does subscription and payment work?
answer: Choose a tutor and Subscribe → confirm monthly fee (USDT) → pay with wallet balance or deposit USDT then pay. When payment is complete you become a member and can view that tutor's coin recommendations. Renewal is auto or manual at expiry depending on settings.

question: How do I deposit USDT?
answer: TRC20 (Tron) is recommended: lower fees and 1–3 minute processing. ERC20 (Ethereum) is optional: higher fees and 5–15 minutes. Send USDT to the deposit address shown by the platform; after confirmation your balance is updated.

question: How do I withdraw USDT?
answer: Request withdrawal in Wallet → after admin approval, funds are sent on the blockchain. Withdrawal fees: you may receive USDT only while the platform covers network (gas) fees; check the platform's policy.

question: What are the fees for subscription, deposit, and withdrawal?
answer: Subscription: you pay the tutor's monthly USDT fee as set. Deposit: blockchain network fees (TRC20/ERC20, etc.) are borne by you at your exchange or wallet. Withdrawal: free or partial fee per platform policy; check the on-screen notice.

question: How do I sign up and log in?
answer: Sign up and log in with social login (Google, Apple, Facebook, etc.). Completing email verification after sign-up is recommended for full access. In Profile you can set language (ko, en, ja, zh, es, fr) and timezone. All times are stored in UTC and shown in your timezone.

question: Who can use Learning?
answer: All logged-in users (regular, associate, member) can use Learning. Menus include Learning home (/learning), Studies (/learning/studies), Exams (/learning/exams), Take exam (/learning/take-exam/:id), Exam results, Voice interview, Questions (/learning/questions), and Text-to-questions (/learning/text-to-questions). Click Become Member to become an associate; after USDT payment you become a member and can also view coin recommendations.

question: How do I find and subscribe to a tutor?
answer: Tutor list (/tutors) for search, filter, sort; Tutor ranking (/tutors/ranking) by grade, temperature, success rate; Tutor detail (/tutors/:id) for profile and Subscribe; My tutors (/my-tutors) for current subscriptions; Performance (/performance) for recommendation summary. Confirm monthly USDT fee then pay with wallet balance or after depositing USDT. After cancellation you keep access until expiry; then access is removed.

question: Who can see coin recommendations?
answer: Only members (who have paid for that tutor's subscription) can view that tutor's coin recommendations. Content includes coin name, current/target price, target date, gain rate, analysis, and status (pending/achieved/failed). You can receive notifications (push/email) when targets are hit.

question: Where do I see subscription and payment history?
answer: Subscriptions (/subscriptions): current tutors, expiry, cancel. Billing (/billing): USDT payment history (subscription fees, etc.).

question: Where is the Wallet menu?
answer: Wallet (/wallet): USDT balance, deposit (address and network selection), withdrawal requests. TRC20 is recommended for deposit; ERC20 is optional. Withdrawal follows platform policy and approval.

question: How do I earn referral income?
answer: My earnings (/referral/my-earnings) shows commission from sign-ups and subscriptions via your referral link. When a user who came via your link subscribes, a percentage (e.g. 1%) may be paid to you in USDT per policy.

question: Where do I manage notifications?
answer: Notifications (/notifications): new recommendations, target achieved, subscription expiring. In Profile you can turn push and email on or off.

question: What are the tutor fees?
answer: Tutors set monthly subscription in USDT only. Platform fee is 30% by default — 30% of subscription is deducted. If marketing is included, additional marketing cost may be charged. Tutor earnings = subscription (USDT) − platform fee (30%, etc.) − marketing cost (if any).

question: How do I apply to become a tutor?
answer: Profile menu → Become a tutor → /tutor/apply. Enter nickname, profile image, bio, investment experience, monthly USDT fee, portfolio link, etc. Agree to tutor terms and platform fee (30% default, extra if marketing). After admin review you get tutor access and start at Bronze.

question: What is on the tutor dashboard?
answer: Dashboard (/tutor/dashboard): subscriber count, monthly USDT revenue, recommendations, success rate, grade and temperature. Recommendations (/tutor/recommendations): list, add, edit, delete. Create recommendation (/tutor/recommendations/create). Subscribers (/tutor/subscribers), Activity history (/tutor/activity-history), Referral (/tutor/referral). All amounts are in USDT.

question: How do I create and manage coin recommendations?
answer: Enter coin, current price (may auto-fill), target price, target date, gain rate, analysis (multilingual). Minimum holding period and minimum target gain vary by grade (e.g. Bronze 7 days/5% to Diamond 45 days/25%). Registration may be restricted if conditions are not met. Status: pending, achieved, failed; the system may auto-mark achieved when target is hit.

question: What are tutor grade and temperature?
answer: Grades: Bronze → Silver → Gold → Platinum → Diamond. You are promoted when conditions (e.g. success rate, minimum recommendations) are met and may be demoted when failures accumulate. Temperature reflects popularity and activity. Check the tutor page for fee rates and benefits by grade.

question: How do tutors handle subscribers, revenue, and payout?
answer: Subscriber management: list of subscribers, start and expiry dates. Revenue: subscription (USDT) minus platform fee (30%, etc.). Payout/withdrawal: per platform policy you can request USDT payout above a threshold or on a schedule (subject to approval and fee policy).

question: How do tutors create learning content?
answer: Tutors can create and manage studies, exams, voice interviews, and questions. Use the learning menu and the study/exam/question management screens to create, edit, and delete.

question: Where do tutors manage referral?
answer: Referral (/tutor/referral): your referral link, subscriptions from the link, and commission paid. Commission is aggregated and paid in USDT per policy.

question: What is the difference between a regular user and a tutor?
answer: Regular user: USDT for subscription, deposit, withdrawal; uses studies/exams/voice interviews/questions; only members see recommendations; pays subscription; wallet for deposit/withdrawal/balance; views own referral earnings. Tutor: USDT for subscription, revenue, payout; creates and manages studies/exams/questions; manages recommendations and stats; pays 30% platform fee (plus marketing if applicable); revenue, payout, withdrawal; referral link and commission history.

question: Where can I find terms of service and privacy policy?
answer: In-app links or paths like /terms-of-service_*, /privacy-policy_*.

question: How do I contact CoinTutor?
answer: Use the Contact page or in-app support. Domain: cointutor.net.
